content.rendered:
I had a chance to talk to Rolf downtown at the Cook County Police Department and these are my findings.

Me: Name?

Rolf: Rolf.

Me: Age?

Rolf: Dog years or people years?

Me: Does it matter?

Rolf: Yes.

Me: Okay, people years.

Rolf: I’m not sure, I was pretty young when I was born, and I lost my birth certificate.

Me: Where were you between the hours of 8 and 9 pm last Friday.

Rolf: At the bar — doing comedy. It doesn’t pay well right now, but I expect to be mediocre some day. Maybe even slightly funny.

Me: Do you have any witnesses to collaborate your story?

Rolf: I’m not sure. I think everyone fell asleep after the first minute of my act. The bartender may have been able to stay awake.

Me: So, Rolf, tell me about yourself. What do you like to do in your free time?

Rolf: Short walks on a long leash.

Me: Where do you like to spend most of your time?

Rolf: In bed.

Me: Other than that?

Rolf: At the dog park.

Me: And what do you do there?

Rolf: I like to check out the girl dogs. You know, do the sniff test. Anyway…

Me: Do you talk to these girl dogs

Rolf: I try to and I’m not shy. I just don’t think they understand me or my sense of humor. I graduated from college, after all. You know, I paid a guy in a dark alley $1,200 for my diploma form Harvard.

Me: Did you actually take any classes?

Rolf: No, why?

Me: What is your favorite food?

Rolf: Cat. No, seriously, I like just about everything — Italian, American, Indian, Hawaiian, Mexican…. I’ve studied British foods but I find most of them to be too bland. And cow tongue, I won’t touch it.

Me: Favorite music.

Rolf: I love Audrey Assad. At least her music. I don’t think she would go for a dog like myself. I love it all — some more than others. It’s like a drug to me. I’m addicted. Seriously.

Me: Drugs? Are drug a problem.

Rolf: Yes. My owner drug me to the opera last Saturday. I kept waiting for the fat lady to sing, but there were none.

Me: What do you drink at the bar?

Rolf: Water, unless I they serve a good chai tea. Do you know how hard it is to find a real good chai tea?

Me: No.

Rolf: I found one place near the University of Arkansas but they want almost $6 for a small cup. A good cup of cappuccino is nearly impossible to find and I’m not going to Italy any time soon.

Me: Speaking of going anywhere, maybe you should plan to stay in town for the next week or two.

Rolf: I plan to. I have shows to preform this Saturday and the next. Besides, I just walked form Vegas where my Pa and Grandpa live and, boy, are my Pas tired.

Me: Do you have any tickets?

Rolf: For you? No. It’s first come first serve. Ten dollar minimum.

Me: Okay, Rolf, you’re free to go — for now. You’ve been very funny — I mean “informative”.

Rolf: Thank you, thank you very muuuch. No, wait. If you have extra dog food, make sure you share it with others who are in need. There are a lot of hungry dogs out there. And make sure you share the love. Don’t keep it to yourself.

Me: Ladies and gentlemen — Rolf the Dawg.
